item.title: Parse, don't validate in TypeScript
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The “parse, don’t validate” approach is all about processing incoming data and failing in a controlled manner if parsing fails. It is all about leveraging trustworthy, secure, and typed data structures within your code and ensuring that all incoming data is handled at the very edges of your systems.
